metadata.titel_preek: Third Sunday After the Epiphany: Epiphany and Baptism of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the mundane and sinful reality of humans to reveal His presence, judge their sin through 'holy dread', and unilaterally establish a new state of salvation and competence.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
God... has power to make our resistance go up in flames
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition
He puts redemption into our blanket

object.identificatie: Salvation, New Life, and the 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: The Holy One of Israel / The Father
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the Exile, the Addict)
tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is the passive Receiver of an unmerited gift.

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / The Holy Spirit / The 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: anoint him with the Holy Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides His own help.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that creates internal competence.

tekstueel_bewijs: the price of sin, idolatry, addiction
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that would cause us to be 'lost' if allowed to play out; it requires a divine 'invasion' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the epiphany: following and witnessing.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter, Gideon, the Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/following) only begins after the Primary Program (epiphany/grace) has established the 'firm ground'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God draws near to them both.
God will interrupt the normal progression.

voorbeelden: keep the covenant they have made
the awareness of sin comes only to those...
power to make our resistance go up in flames
from a sphere of power capable of calling into existence

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where man is 'deficient' or 'lost'. Grace is the endowment of competence to the incompetent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the Mundane (~S1) to the Terrifying Presence (S2), which is then resolved by Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Enabling Word' which transforms the terror of S2 into the peace of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon insists that God is 'opposed to us' in our sin before being 'for us'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in every narrative arc. Human effort is explicitly sidelined as insufficient.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are trying to turn ourselves around.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask us what we are doing... he just gives the gift.
God will interrupt the normal progression of things by arriving.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are not models of virtue to emulate, but examples of human inadequacy met by divine initiative.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God chooses the 'nonentity' and the 'sinful man'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-salvation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic view of grace where God initiates and completes the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terror' of the law/holiness to the 'comfort' of the gospel is perfectly integrated.
spanning_punten: The paradox of God being 'opposed to us' yet 'for us'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the one who anoints and enables the 'bold confession'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'addiction' and 'rebelliousness' that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict Greimassian structure where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver. It avoids the 'Helper-God' trap.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Sin/Death) is already treated as a cosmic force.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It successfully navigates the 'holy dread' of Epiphany without falling into moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'funny' Gideon anecdote, semiotics reveals that Gideon's 'nonentity' status is a functional requirement for God to be the sole Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Midianites; semiotics explains why the 'fire from the rock' is a modal shift in 'Pouvoir'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'addict' in the bus terminal is an actantial parallel to Peter; both are 'Receivers' of an external 'Object' (redemption) they did not 'Subjectively' earn.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's grammar effectively, ensuring God is the subject of the transformative verbs.
